title: Astrobotic “Emboldened” Despite Peregrine Failure
summary: Astrobotic CEO John Thornton today acknowledged disappointment that the Peregrine lunar lander did not achieve its goal of landing on the Moon, but was upbeat about how they responded to […]

title: Google and AT&T join $155 million AST SpaceMobile investment
summary: Google and AT&T have joined a $155 million strategic investment in AST SpaceMobile, which is set to raise double that to help fund its direct-to-smartphone connectivity constellation.

title: Astrobotic to begin formal investigation into failed Peregrine mission
summary: With the Peregrine lunar lander mission now complete, Astrobotic is turning its attention to understanding what went wrong with the spacecraft and incorporating any changes into a much larger lander for NASA.

title: Japan’s SLIM Successfully Lands on Moon, But Will Have Limited Lifetime
summary: Japan became the fifth country to successfully soft land on the Moon today. The Small Lander for Investigating Moon, SLIM, touched down as scheduled, but its solar cells are not […]

title: Office of Space Commerce starts commercial pathfinder project for civil space traffic coordination system
summary: The Office of Space Commerce has selected three companies to participate in a pathfinder program that could lead to the incorporation of commercial data into its space traffic coordination system.
